data.title: Trevor Thompson (footballer, born 1955)
data.text:
English footballer (1955–2021)

John Trevor Thompson (21 May 1955 – December 2021) was an English professional footballer who played as a full-back. Active in England and the United States, Thompson made over 150 career league appearances.

Career

[edit]

Born in North Shields,[1] Thompson began his career with West Bromwich Albion; after joining the youth team, Thompson made 20 appearances for the first team between 1973 and 1976.[2] After a spell in the North American Soccer League with the Washington Diplomats,[3] Thompson returned to England to play with Newport County, where he made 35 appearances between 1978 and 1979.[4] Thompson's final English league club was Lincoln City, where he made 80 league appearances between 1979 and 1982.[5] Thompson later played non-league football with Gainsborough Trinity and Worksop Town,[6] and managed Boston Town.[7]

He died in December 2021, at the age of 66.[8]
